property.name: text
property.value: Simulate the driver of the leading car. Output is the driver's desired speed.

property.name: text
property.value: Simulate a car that matches the desired speed using feedback control with a specified time constant.

property.name: text
property.value: Simulate a wireless network that corrupts the data when the fault input is true.

property.name: text
property.value: Car simulator. This model takes as input a desired speed and implements a simple proportional controller with the specified time constant to achieve that speed. It outputs the acceleration, speed, and position of the car.

property.name: text
property.value: This model outputs the desired speed of a driver that wishes to maintain a nominal speed (55 miles per hour in this case), but superimposes a jitter (plus or minus 30 miles per hour in this case). It thus models a highly irregular driver.

display.name: Const Nominal Speed in miles per hour

property.name: text
property.value: Check data coming in over the network. If it doesn't make sense, declare a fault.

property.name: text
property.value: In normal mode, use the incoming speed as the desired speed. In the faulty mode, set the desired speed to zero.

property.name: text
property.value: Simulate a car that matches the desired speed using feedback control with a specified time constant.

property.name: text
property.value: If the estimate of the current position based on the previous message from the leading car and the elapsed time is not close to the current position reported by the leading car, then report a fault.

property.name: text
property.value: Car simulator. This model takes as input a desired speed and implements a simple proportional controller with the specified time constant to achieve that speed. It outputs the acceleration, speed, and position of the car.
